Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2007 01:13AM Hate_It wrote: It's late Monday night.  Just wanted to post before going to sleep.  Had my 4th FAC treatment 12/03.  Next one 12/24.  I noticed more this one has been the worst.  No nausea until now and extreme fatigue. Had treatment on Monday and didn't come back to life until Friday. I felt like Alice in Wonderland falling into that hole. I was doing OK with side effects until now...have anticipatory side effects due to smell of chemo suite.  Once loved water but now the thought of it nauseates me due to have to suck on ice chips during Adriamycin.  I am not a happy camper right now.  Have tried to staypositive but don't have the energy to keep up the  p

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2007 11:29AM Hate_It wrote: Dear Ulla Hamsa, as I found out myself, everybody here is with you and truly feels your pain.  I hold you and all the girls up in prayer.  Hope you feel better soon and I pray that it lasts awhile.  Like Texas Karen said, "No pain, no gain"  Tuff one to swallow but it's all we got! xoxo to all
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2007 11:25AM Hate_It wrote: Thank you Carpediempenny and Kara. I have only 2 more tx's, next 12/24 and 1/14 is my last!!  Tired of sounding negative, but it sounds so easy, "only 2 more".  The fact of the matter, AS YOU ALL KNOW :), is that you have to deal with the weeks that follow each treatment!  OK, enough sniveling. (I can't help but think of how grateful I am for this group each time I post)  Anytime anyone is having a pity party, I'd like to be invited :)  I rather enjoy them sometimes LOL  I'll bring the shot glasses!
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2007 04:43PM - edited Dec 11, 2007 04:47PM by Hate_It It's late Monday night.  Just wanted to post before going to sleep.  Had my 4th FAC treatment 12/03.  Next one 12/24.  I noticed more this one has been the worst.  No nausea until now and extreme fatigue. Had treatment on Monday and didn't come back to life until Friday. I felt like Alice in Wonderland falling into that hole. I was doing OK with side effects until now...have anticipatory side effects due to smell of chemo suite.  Once loved water but now the thought of it nauseates me due to have to suck on ice chips during Adriamycin.  I am not a happy camper right now.  Have tried to stay positive but don't have the energy to keep up the pretense. Maybe I'll feel better  tomorrow and I'll have something positive to say.  Truth is I am scared to  death.  So glad you are here to help.  xoxo
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 07:07AM Hate_It wrote: Hello Girls...my heart goes out to all of you who are not feeling so well, I pray it's get better soon.  And for those of you who are feeling better...HOORAY!  A quickie then some solemn news.... for the past couple of days I'd been dealing with heartburn and took lots of Tums. This morning I woke up looking like Chow...black spots on my tongue! LOL  The solemn and sad news is that I got a call from my 66 yr young aunt last nite (a lady with a beautiful heart) and she told me that she was dx'd with IDC on 11/30 in the left breast (2.8cm)  Her first appt with onc is Thur.  Please add her to your prayers (Sandy Aguilar).  I know she has a lot of faith, but I could still hear the fear of the unknown in her voice.  Luv u guys....and I wish you all a lovely day.
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee
